etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Samuel Taylor Coleridge (1772–1834), poet, critic, and philosopher. From re- + identify

definitions: To re-establish or reconfirm the identity of; to identify again.
To make a new and different identification of; to reascribe the identity of.
(reflexive) and without object. To identify oneself with something again. Chiefly with with.
